rows.title: What does ** (double star/asterisk) and * (star/asterisk) do for parameters?

155:
<p>This table is handy for using <code>*</code> and <code>**</code> in function <em>construction</em> and function <em>call</em>:</p>

<pre class="lang-py s-code-block"><code class="hljs language-python">            In function construction         In function call
=======================================================================
          |  <span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">f</span>(<span class="hljs-params">*args</span>):                 |  <span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">f</span>(<span class="hljs-params">a, b</span>):
*args     |      <span class="hljs-keyword">for</span> arg <span class="hljs-keyword">in</span> args:          |      <span class="hljs-keyword">return</span> a + b
          |          <span class="hljs-built_in">print</span>(arg)            |  args = (<span class="hljs-number">1</span>, <span class="hljs-number">2</span>)
          |  f(<span class="hljs-number">1</span>, <span class="hljs-number">2</span>)                       |  f(*args)
----------|--------------------------------|---------------------------
          |  <span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">f</span>(<span class="hljs-params">a, b</span>):                  |  <span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">f</span>(<span class="hljs-params">a, b</span>):
**kwargs  |      <span class="hljs-keyword">return</span> a + b              |      <span class="hljs-keyword">return</span> a + b
          |  <span class="hljs-keyword">def</span> <span class="hljs-title function_">g</span>(<span class="hljs-params">**kwargs</span>):              |  kwargs = <span class="hljs-built_in">dict</span>(a=<span class="hljs-number">1</span>, b=<span class="hljs-number">2</span>)
          |      <span class="hljs-keyword">return</span> f(**kwargs)        |  f(**kwargs)
          |  g(a=<span class="hljs-number">1</span>, b=<span class="hljs-number">2</span>)                   |
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
</code></pre>

<p>This really just serves to summarize Lorin Hochstein's <a href="https://stackoverflow.com/a/36926/7954504">answer</a> but I find it helpful.</p>

<p>Relatedly: uses for the star/splat operators have been <a href="https://docs.python.org/3/whatsnew/3.5.html#pep-448-additional-unpacking-generalizations" rel="noreferrer">expanded</a> in Python 3</p>
